Depository Library Program

Last Updated: July 29, 2017

The International Monetary Fund disseminates information by using a wide variety of publications relating to all aspects of international monetary matters and IMF operations. The Depository Library program of the IMF plays a key role in making the research and analyses in these publications more accessible to the public. Under this program, libraries receive a wide selection of the IMF's new printed publications, free of charge. In addition, a collection of existing books, periodicals, statistical publications, videos, CDs, and series titles are supplied to these libraries. They, in turn, agree to catalog and shelve the material in keeping with normal library practices and make them available free of charge to the general public.

View a list of IMF depository libraries.

IMF Depository Library Program Qualifications

IMF Depository Library Program Application for Designation

For more information about the International Monetary Fund's depository library program, please e-mail: DepositoryLibrary@IMF.org
